model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
You job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Speaker A, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes" or "No"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: I'm pretty excited! They just added one of my favorite dishes to the menu at work. I can't wait for my next shift so I can try it for free. I will send you a pic later, ok? 
Speaker B: Okay, yes, please send me a pic as soon as you can. I can't wait to see it. What is the name of the dish?
Speaker A: It's a Chicken parmesan, with a red pepper marinara. It's so crisp and juicy-I love it! They serve it with these sweet roasted asparagus!
Speaker B: Oh that sounds absolutely fabulous. Are you going to get a free dessert, as well?
Speaker A: Yes, I am thinking about trying either the new eclairs, or their tres leches cake with fresh raspberry jam sauce and lemon drizzle! I have too many good options to pick from! What one would you pick?
Speaker B: Hands down, I would pick the tres leches. Ever since I tried it a few years ago, it has always been my favorite dessert.
Speaker A: Okay, I will try that! I've heard the can be made with different fruits. Did you have fruit with yours?
Speaker B: I like it best with fresh strawberries. And then it is even better with some fresh whipped cream and chocolate drizzle. Just thinking about it is making me want to have some right now!

MEMORY:
Speaker A enjoys the interaction with people at work and the variety of experiences that come with it. Speaker A works at a restaurant and gets two free meals per week, along with taking home leftover baked goods. Speaker A works at a restaurant and invited Speaker B to visit. Speaker A owns a restaurant and recently experienced a fire incident but managed to put it out. Speaker A is a restaurant worker who enjoys working there but finds it very busy.

raw_prediction: That sounds like a delicious combination! I'll definitely try it with strawberries and all the extra toppings. Can't wait for my next shift to indulge in all these goodies.
prediction:
Brief explanation: The MEMORY contains some information relevant to the dialogue, such as Speaker A working at a restaurant and getting free meals. However, the specific details of the memory—like the fire incident or inviting Speaker B to visit—are not relevant to the current context about the chicken parmesan, tres leches, or dessert preferences. Since the information provided doesn't add any insight or context that directly relates to the ongoing discussion, it is not helpful.
Judgement: No
